job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in San Diego, CA
pros:
Team work environment
A lot of focus on employee wellness, reducing burn out, and employee retention
Bonuses for seeing patients over productivity goal
Great leadership 
Good benefits package
Innovative and responsible business practices
Improved communication in the past year
Productivity goals are very reasonable
Before COVID, you had the option of taking on special projects to improve patient care
cons:
20 minute follow up appointments limit what you can do during follow up appointments (better than the 15 minutes like some other places), but this is just part of working on a FQHC
Limited career advancement options for nurse practitioners within organization

job_title: Registered Nurse in El Cajon, CA
pros: Patient care, community based. Great coworkers.
cons: Nehative environment. DON lacks managerial skills, instills fear and accuses without investigating the facts. HR is not there to provide support to employees, it does not respect confidentiality.

review_title: definitely burned out, a corporation rather than non-profit
pros: My coworkers are nice. It’s for them that I have lasted this long. My experience here was better a few years ago, when we had some different leaders and before new people were hired to make changes to increase profit.
cons: This is more like a for profit corporation than a non-profit. Decisions are made top-down. They talk about being leaders in business in healthcare instead of being leaders in patient care and employee experience. So sad, the non-profit philosophy is gone and we are all worked to our core. We keep saying we’re burned out and the response we get is that they appreciate that we work really hard. Training in all areas of employee welfare is needed for upper management. If you interview here, please ask them how many times they ask their employees for feedback about the direction the company is headed. The answer is zero. I’m talking about productivity, people getting let go, and staff support being gone. I’m charting all weekend and all my days off.

pros: I started here as volunteer and then one day the job I really wanted, opened its doors for me. I had fun working here for over 4years. I never stopped learning, because  everyday we always encounter different things, different situations and and you get to meet different people and different patients with their different stories. There was never a dull moments, and employees have great teamwork and always willing to help And care for each other. The site manager, supervisors and leads are nice and very helpful.
cons: None that I’ve known of.

pros: Decent pay.... that’s all.
cons: So much hostility at this place. If you are not a higher power they will NEVER listen to you. 100% micromanagement if the supervisor does not like you they will do everything in there power to get you fired. HR is useless. They will not try and resolve anything. If you apply for this job make sure you watch your back and don’t trust anyone!

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Escondido, CA
pros: Manager was always very accommodating when requesting paid time off. There is opportunity to grow and learn in the company. I was offered good training before being on my own.
cons: The health benefits are pricey if you want to add spouse or family member. Productivity is a big factor when measuring performance, which is sometimes unfair when dealing with difficult patient who take a lot of time.
